title: Sh?ki, the Demon Queller
marks:
Inscription and Mark

upper half of image, in in
text: "The army of demons surrendered,' according to the inscription atop this portrait of Sh'ki, the Queller of Demons. A deity from China's Daoist pantheon, Sh'ki is usually shown with one or more demons, but his fierceness in this portrait appears to have driven them away. Keisen moved to Kyoto to study under Tsuji Kak' and was known among local painters for, among other things, his excessive partying.
creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
